title: Bruce Forsyth is on the mend now he's back home after five days in intensive care
text:
Showbiz Bruce Forsyth is on the mend now he's back home after five days in intensive care Since returning in an ambulance to his mansion in Virginia Water, Surrey, the game-show legend has been nursed by wife Wilnelia, 59 Share Sir Bruce Forsyth is said to be on the mend at his mansion in Surrey with wife Wilnelia (Photo: PA) Share Get daily   
Bruce Forsyth ’s daughter has told how the star is on the mend after his latest hospital stay. 
Fans will be relieved to hear Sir Bruce, 89, is recovering well after five days in intensive care. 
The ex- Strictly Come Dancing host was rushed to St Peter’s Hospital in Surrey with a serious chest infection. 
Since returning in an ambulance to his mansion in Virginia Water, Surrey, the game-show legend has been nursed by wife Wilnelia, 59. St Peter's Hospital 
And according to Julie Forsyth, the second eldest of Sir Bruce’s five ­daughters, the TV favourite is perking up. 
Julie, 58, told The Sunday People : “I have been to see him and he’s doing great. 
“He is getting over a chest ­infection so it’s a bit difficult, but he’s doing good.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Brucie dances on the BBC for his 80th birthday Share this video Watch Next 
She said all six of Bruce’s children had been at his bedside in hospital.“We were all up there,” she said. “All the girls rallied round, and his son.” 
Sir Bruce’s hospital ­drama came just days ­after his 89th birthday when Wilnelia wished him “a ton of health” on Instagram. 
Hospital ­manager Ian Wilson told how Sir Bruce was ­grateful to the NHS staff who saved his life. Bruce Forsyth and his wife Wilnelia (Photo: Getty) 
Mr Wilson said: “Sir Bruce would like to thank everyone for their good wishes. 
“He and his family would also like to say a special thank you to all the NHS doctors, nurses and staff at St Peter’s Hospital for their kindness and care.” 
The star has never fully recovered from two aneurysms – bulges in blood vessels –and surgery in 2015. Sir Bruce Forsyth with his three week-old granddaughter, Anastasia Monro (Photo: BBC) 
But Mr Wilson revealed Sir Bruce has made “no formal or informal decision” on retiring. 
The veteran presenter was too frail to attend the funeral of his close friend Ronnie Corbett last year. 
And Wilnelia admitted in November that Bruce has problems moving and they have spoken about the day when he’ll no longer be around. 
She said: “He’s the man I fell in love with because his brain is still there.” Like us on Facebook
